The town of derpopolis contains 200 people. 120 are of workign age. Of those people: 15 don't want work, 5 have given up looking for work, 79 have a full-time job, 11 have a part-time job and would like to get a full time job, and 10 are activily looking for work. How many people in the labor force?

The town of derpopolis contains 200 people. 120 are of workign age. Of those people: 15 don't want work, 5 have given up looking for work, 79 have a full-time job, 11 have a part-time job and would like to get a full time job, and 10 are activily looking for work. How many people are unemployed?

rival, non-excludable: Name the type of good.
Intro, GDP, CPI, Unemployment, Inflation (macro)
What is a term used to describe the buying of 15 new sewing machines by an apparel company?
What is the name of the situation in which an individual is without a job but is looking for work?
What type of unemployment is experienced for a worker who is unemployed because his skills are obsolete?
What type of unemployment is experienced for a recent college graduate who is looking for her first job?
Assume that last year's CPI was 150 and nominal income was $30,000. If today's CPI is 160, how much does nominal income need to increase for the same real income?
If nominal income rises 4% and real income falls 1%, what is the percent change in price level?
Which of the following best measures the change in price level of national product: consumer price index, GDP deflator, or producer price index?
What model shows the relationship between the transfer of goods and services between households and industries?
At what point is this economy producing at an allocatively inefficient level? ("Point _")
At what point would this economy be producing at an impossible level?
If a bank wishes to earn a 2% real interest rate on the loans it makes, and if the inflation rate is 5%, then what nominal percent interest rate should the bank charge for its loans?
If the Consumer Price Index is 100 in the one year and 108 in the next, then what was the inflation rate between these two years?
Expenditures for new military aircraft count as part of what category of spending in GDP?
What price index is based on a sampling of households and businesses?
Suppose a refrigerator is built in 2010, but not sold to a consumer until April 2011. In which year's GDP does the refrigerator count?
AD, AS, LRAS, and Econ Growth (macro)
What curve demonstrates the combined production of all the producers in a nation in the short run?
What curve demonstrates the combined production of all the producers in a nation in the long run?
What curve demonstrates the combined wants of all the consumers in a nation?
Which way will the demand curve as a result of an improvement in technology?
Which way will the demand curve as a result of an improvement in technology?
Which way will the supply curve shift as a result of an improvement in technology?

An increased population size and not change in productivity would ___ real income per capita.

A rightward shift of AD would cause SRAS to shift what direction?
A decrease in taxes would shift AD what direction?
A government policy that encourages saving and investment would shift LRAS which direction?
What will happen to unemployment if consumption spending increases?
What shape is the AS curve in the long run?
What would happen to U.S. GDP if an American entrepreneur founds and locates a software company in London?
In an economy with a horizontal supply curve, an increase in government spending will cause output to change in what way?

Name him.

Will lenders or borrowers experience losses if deflations occurs unexpectedly?

What is the name for money that has intrinsic value?

How would the simple spending multiplier change if the marginal propensity to consume decreased?

According to supply-side economists, what should be decreased to shift the AS curve right?
What is the name for the effect for which competition between the government and private borrowers for loanable funds results in an increase in interest rates?
In a long period of economic expansion, how will the amount spent on welfare programs change?
What is the name of this curve?

Which way will the Phillips curve shift if there is a negative supply shock?

if a U.S. firm builds a new factory in China, what component of the balance of payments account will this contribute to?

Crimson Questions (extra)
